alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 8:22PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chouteau and northeastern Cascade Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 821 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Highwood, or 16 miles southwest of Fort Benton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Benton, Carter and Floweree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Western and Central Chouteau County
